trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi using PSK | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi using PSK | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use Custom Configuration to create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key.
trans-unit.target: Use Custom Configuration to create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key.

trans-unit.source: Create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key
trans-unit.target: Create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key

trans-unit.source: Here's how to use Intune’s **Custom Configuration** to create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key.
trans-unit.target: Here's how to use Intune’s **Custom Configuration** to create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key.

trans-unit.source: This topic also has an example of how to create an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile.
trans-unit.target: This topic also has an example of how to create an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile.

trans-unit.source: You might find it easier to copy the code from a computer that connects to that network, as described below.
trans-unit.target: You might find it easier to copy the code from a computer that connects to that network, as described below.

trans-unit.source: For Android, you also have the option of using this [Android PSK Generator](http://johnathonb.com/2015/05/intune-android-pre-shared-key-generator/) provided by Johnathon Biersack.
trans-unit.target: For Android, you also have the option of using this [Android PSK Generator](http://johnathonb.com/2015/05/intune-android-pre-shared-key-generator/) provided by Johnathon Biersack.

trans-unit.source: You can add multiple networks and keys by adding more OMA-URI settings.
trans-unit.target: You can add multiple networks and keys by adding more OMA-URI settings.

trans-unit.source: For iOS, use Apple Configurator on a Mac station to set up the profile.
trans-unit.target: For iOS, use Apple Configurator on a Mac station to set up the profile.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, use this [iOS PSK Mobile Config Generator](http://johnathonb.com/2015/05/intune-ios-psk-mobile-config-generator/) provided by Johnathon Biersack.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, use this [iOS PSK Mobile Config Generator](http://johnathonb.com/2015/05/intune-ios-psk-mobile-config-generator/) provided by Johnathon Biersack.

trans-unit.source: To create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key for Android or Windows or an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile, when you create a policy choose **Custom Configuration** for that device platform rather than a Wi-Fi profile.
trans-unit.target: To create a Wi-Fi profile with a pre-shared key for Android or Windows or an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile, when you create a policy choose **Custom Configuration** for that device platform rather than a Wi-Fi profile.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name and description.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name and description.

trans-unit.source: Add a new OMA-URI setting:
trans-unit.target: Add a new OMA-URI setting:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for this Wi-Fi network setting.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for this Wi-Fi network setting.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Enter a description of the OMA-URI setting or leave blank.
trans-unit.target: Enter a description of the OMA-URI setting or leave blank.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: **Data Type**: Set to "String(XML)"
trans-unit.target: **Data Type**: Set to "String(XML)"

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: **OMA-URI**:
trans-unit.target: **OMA-URI**:

trans-unit.source: **For Android**: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/<SSID>/Settings
trans-unit.target: **For Android**: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/<SSID>/Settings

trans-unit.source: **For Windows**: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/MyNetwork/WlanXml
trans-unit.target: **For Windows**: ./Vendor/MSFT/WiFi/Profile/MyNetwork/WlanXml

trans-unit.source: Be sure to include the dot character at the beginning.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to include the dot character at the beginning.

trans-unit.source: SSID is the SSID for which you’re creating the policy.
trans-unit.target: SSID is the SSID for which you’re creating the policy.

trans-unit.source: For example,
trans-unit.target: For example,

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: **Value Field** is where you paste your XML code.
trans-unit.target: **Value Field** is where you paste your XML code.

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example.
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example.

trans-unit.source: Each value should be adapted to your network settings.
trans-unit.target: Each value should be adapted to your network settings.

trans-unit.source: See the comments section of the code for some pointers.
trans-unit.target: See the comments section of the code for some pointers.

trans-unit.source: Choose **OK**, save, and then deploy the policy.
trans-unit.target: Choose **OK**, save, and then deploy the policy.

trans-unit.source: This policy can only be deployed to user groups.
trans-unit.target: This policy can only be deployed to user groups.

trans-unit.source: The next time each device checks in, the policy will be applied, and a Wi-Fi profile will be created on the device.
trans-unit.target: The next time each device checks in, the policy will be applied, and a Wi-Fi profile will be created on the device.

trans-unit.source: The device will be able to connect to the network automatically.
trans-unit.target: The device will be able to connect to the network automatically.

trans-unit.source: Android or Windows Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: Android or Windows Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of the XML code for an Android or Windows Wi-Fi profile:
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of the XML code for an Android or Windows Wi-Fi profile:

trans-unit.source: must be set to **false**, as **true** could cause device to expect an encrypted password and then try to decrypt it, which may result in a failed connection.
trans-unit.target: must be set to **false**, as **true** could cause device to expect an encrypted password and then try to decrypt it, which may result in a failed connection.

trans-unit.source: should be set to the hexadecimal value of `<name><SSID of wifi profile></name>`.
trans-unit.target: should be set to the hexadecimal value of `<name><SSID of wifi profile></name>`.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 devices may return a false *0x87D1FDE8 Remediation failed* error, but will still be provisioned with the profile.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 devices may return a false *0x87D1FDE8 Remediation failed* error, but will still be provisioned with the profile.

trans-unit.source: EAP-based Wi-Fi profile
trans-unit.target: EAP-based Wi-Fi profile

trans-unit.source: Here’s an example of the XML code for an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile:
trans-unit.target: Here’s an example of the XML code for an EAP-based Wi-Fi profile:

trans-unit.source: Create the XML file from an existing Wi-Fi connection
trans-unit.target: Create the XML file from an existing Wi-Fi connection

trans-unit.source: You can also create an XML file from an existing Wi-Fi connection:
trans-unit.target: You can also create an XML file from an existing Wi-Fi connection:

trans-unit.source: On a computer that is connected to or has recently connected to the wireless network, open the following folder: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Wlansvc\Profiles\Interfaces\{guid}.
trans-unit.target: On a computer that is connected to or has recently connected to the wireless network, open the following folder: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Wlansvc\Profiles\Interfaces\{guid}.

trans-unit.source: It’s best to use a computer that has not connected to many wireless networks, because you’ll have to search through each profile to find the right one.
trans-unit.target: It’s best to use a computer that has not connected to many wireless networks, because you’ll have to search through each profile to find the right one.

trans-unit.source: Search through the XML files to locate the one with the right name.
trans-unit.target: Search through the XML files to locate the one with the right name.

trans-unit.source: After you have located the correct XML file, copy and paste the XML code into the Data field of the OMA-URI settings page.
trans-unit.target: After you have located the correct XML file, copy and paste the XML code into the Data field of the OMA-URI settings page.

trans-unit.source: Deploy the policy
trans-unit.target: Deploy the policy

trans-unit.source: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Policy** workspace, select the policy that you want to deploy, and then choose **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box:

trans-unit.source: **To deploy the policy** - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.
trans-unit.target: **To deploy the policy** - Select one or more groups to which you want to deploy the policy, and then choose **Add** > **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **To close the dialog box without deploying it** - Choose **Cancel**.
trans-unit.target: **To close the dialog box without deploying it** - Choose **Cancel**.

trans-unit.source: When you select a deployed policy, you can view more information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.
trans-unit.target: When you select a deployed policy, you can view more information about the deployment in the lower part of the policies list.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi connections in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi connections in Microsoft Intune
